intro: Luma ribeireana, commonly known as Brazilian holly, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained acidic soils. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to tolerate partial shade. Luma ribeireana also plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
